data.text:
18 Notable alumni of

Lebanese American University

Updated: February 29, 2024

EduRank

Lebanese American University is 1379th in the world, 302nd in Asia, and 4th in Lebanon by aggregated alumni prominence. Below is the list of 18 notable alumni from Lebanese American University sorted by their wiki pages popularity. The directory includes famous graduates and former students along with research and academic staff.

Valerie Abou Chacra

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1992-.. (age 32)

Occupations

beauty pageant contestantactor

Biography

Valerie Abou Chacra is a Lebanese actress and beauty pageant titleholder who was crowned Miss Lebanon 2015. She represented Lebanon at Miss World 2015. She has also starred in widely watched Arabic TV series such as 'Ma Fiyi'

Rima Maktabi

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1977-.. (age 47)

Enrolled in Lebanese American University

Graduated with bachelor's degree

Occupations

television presenterjournalistinternational forum participant

Biography

Rima Maktabi is a Lebanese TV presenter and award-winning journalist who returned to al-Arabiya after hosting CNN's monthly program Inside the Middle East for two years and previously working at the Arab satellite channel since 2005. She was among several female Arab journalists who first became known through her reporting during the 2006 Lebanon War and who had successful careers afterward, including Maktabi and her former colleague at al-Arabiya Najwa Qassem.

Sethrida Geagea

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1967-.. (age 57)

Occupations

socialite

Biography

Sethrida Tawk Geagea, is a Lebanese politician and MP since June 2005 from the Bcharri district. She is also a member of the executive committee of the Lebanese Forces, headed by her husband, Samir Geagea. She contributed greatly to the management of the Lebanese Forces Party during Samir Geagea's Arrest between 1994 and 2005.

Hind Hariri

Born in

Saudi Arabia

Years

1984-.. (age 40)

Occupations

socialite

Biography

Hind Rafic al-Hariri is the youngest child of Lebanese businessman and politician Rafic Hariri. She graduated from the Lebanese American University in Beirut and campaigned for her half-brother Saad in Lebanese elections. In 2008, Forbes magazine listed her as "one of the world's youngest billionaires".

Dominique Hourani

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1985-.. (age 39)

Occupations

singermodelactorsocialite

Biography

Dominique Hourani is a Lebanese recording artist, actress, beauty queen, and former model.

Fahda bint Saud

Born in

Saudi Arabia

Years

1953-.. (age 71)

Occupations

painterwriter

Biography

Fahda bint Saud Al Saud is a Saudi royal and artist.

Maya Reaidy

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1995-.. (age 29)

Occupations

pharmacistmodel

Biography

Maya Reaidy is a Lebanese model and beauty pageant titleholder who was crowned Miss Lebanon 2018. She represented Lebanon at the Miss Universe 2018 pageant in Bangkok, Thailand.

Nadine Wilson Njeim

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1988-.. (age 36)

Occupations

actormodelbeauty pageant contestant

Biography

Nadine Wilson Njeim is a Lebanese actress and beauty pageant titleholder who was elected Miss Lebanon 2007. She represented her country in Miss World 2007 in China and Miss Universe 2007 in Mexico.

Kim Ghattas

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1977-.. (age 47)

Occupations

opinion journalistjournalist

Biography

Kim Ghattas is a Lebanese journalist based in Beirut who writes for The Atlantic. Previously, she covered the US State Department for the BBC. She is a scholar at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace and the author of Black Wave: Saudi Arabia, Iran, and the Forty-Year Rivalry That Unraveled Culture, Religion, and Collective Memory in the Middle East, which The New York Times recognized as one of the "100 Notable Books of 2020."

Nadim Kobeissi

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1990-.. (age 34)

Occupations

cryptographer

Biography

Nadim Kobeissi is a French-Lebanese computer science researcher specialized in applied cryptography. He is the author of Cryptocat, an open-source encrypted web chat client. Kobeissi is also known for speaking publicly against Internet censorship and Internet surveillance.

Zeina Akar

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1964-.. (age 60)

Enrolled in Lebanese American University

Graduated with bachelor's degree

Occupations

politician

Biography

Zeina Adra is a Lebanese politician who served as the Defence Minister and Deputy Prime Minister of Lebanon from 21 January 2020 to 10 September 2021. She was the first female defence minister in the Arab world.

Lara Habib Chamat

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1980-.. (age 44)

Occupations

television presenterpresenterinternational forum participant

Biography

Lara Habib Chamat is a Lebanese Senior Business News presenter on Al Arabiya News Channel.

Zaven Kouyoumdjian

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1970-.. (age 54)

Occupations

television presenterjournalistnews presenter

Biography

Zaven Kouyoumdjian is a Lebanese talk show host, producer and television personality of both Armenian and Arab descent. He is also a media researcher and author of four books, including Lebanon's best-seller Lebanon Shot Twice. in 2021, Zaven joined The Munathara Initiative as the host of their Lebanese version of Townhall, a show that brings together key national broadcasters to commit to public interest journalism. Simultaneously, Zaven hosts and produces the morning show of Sawt Kel Lebnan radio station and DRI’s online talk show, Nafas Jdeed.

Wansa

Born in

Iraq

Years

1917-2015 (aged 98)

Occupations

socialite

Biography

Mira Khatun Wansa, Wansa Ismail el-Amawy or simply Wansa was a Yazidi princess. In 1934–1938 she was the wife of Mir Sa'id Beg. Wansa was born in Tikrit and was a daughter of Ismail Beg. Her brothers were Mua'wia, Abd el-Karim and Yezid Khan.

Salim Sayegh

Years

1961-.. (age 63)

Occupations

politician

Biography

Salim Sayegh is a Lebanese academic and politician who served as minister of social affairs from 2009 to 2011.

Mounira Solh

Years

1911-2010 (aged 99)

Occupations

activistpolitician

Biography

Mounira Solh was a pioneer advocate for the rights of women and people with disabilities in Lebanon. She was one of the first women in Lebanon and the Middle East to run for parliament. She ran for a seat in the Parliament of Lebanon in 1960, 1964 and 1968. She was also a humanitarian with decades of volunteer and charity work.

Abd al-Rahman al-Kayyali

Born in

Syria

Years

1887-1969 (aged 82)

Occupations

physicianpoliticiancivil servant

Biography

Abd al-Rahman al-Kayyali was a physician from the city of Aleppo and member of the Syrian independence movement who served as the Minister of Justice for two terms.

Sana Solh

Born in

Lebanon

Years

1939-2019 (aged 80)

Occupations

activist

Biography

Sana Solh was a Lebanese human rights activist who advocated for the respect and equal rights of women, children and persons with disabilities through social and political change. She was one of the main female leaders of the civil rights movements in Lebanon, actively working, lobbying and leading demonstrations to fight for the right of women to grant their nationality to their children, ask for laws to guarantee quotas for women's participation in politics, or raise funds for the many institutions and associations where she was an active member.
